text: Pistillaria is a genus of fungi in the order Agaricales. The genus has a widespread distribution in northern temperate areas, and contains about 50 species. Pistillaria was defined by Swedish mycologist Elias Magnus Fries in 1821. ==Species== *P. alba *P. attenuata *P. batesii *P. bellunensis *P. bipindiensis *P. cylindrospora *P. diaphana *P. dubia *P. elegantula *P. filiformis *P. fuegiana *P. fuscipes *P. gilva *P. glandulosa *P. lignicola *P. limicola *P. linearis *P. lividula *P. misella *P. montevidensis *P. mycophila *P. paradoxa *P. peronata *P. petasitis *P. phaeosperma *P. quercicola *P. quercus *P. rhodocionides *P. saxegothaeae *P. subfasciculata *P. subglobispora *P. subuncialis *P. tenera *P. tenuis *P. trichomorpha *P. trispora *P. icola ==See also== *List of Agaricales genera ==References== Category:Typhulaceae Category:Agaricales genera Category:Taxa named by Elias Magnus Fries
title: Pistillaria
